revision.comment: /* top */[[WP:AWB/GF#Talk page general fixes|talk page general fixes]] & other cleanup per [[WP:TPL]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (11961)
revision.text:
{{Article history |action1=GAN |action1date=08:25, 1 September 2013 |action1link=Talk:Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=571049349 |action2=PR |action2date=06:30, 8 October 2013 |action2link=Wikipedia:Peer review/Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty/archive1 |action2result=reviewed |action2oldid= 574824786 |action3=FAC |action3date=10:01, 14 January 2014 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Jin campaigns against the Song Dynasty/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=590643780 |action4=FTC |action4date=04:03, 1 June 2014 (UTC) |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Song Dynasty/addition1 |action4result=not promoted |currentstatus=FA |maindate=January 31, 2014 |topic=warfare |dykdate=4 August 2013 |dykentry=... that the [[Jurchens]] '''[[Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty|captured]]''' the [[Song Dynasty]] emperor [[Emperor Qinzong of Song|Qinzong]] and the former emperor [[Emperor Huizong of Song|Huizong]] ''(pictured)'' during the second [[Jingkang Incident|siege of Kaifeng]] in 1126? |otddate=October 11, 2013 |otdlink=Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/October 11 |four=yes }} {{WikiProject banner shell|1= {{WikiProject China|class=FA|history=yes|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA|B1=y |B2=y |B3=y |B4=y |B5=y |Chinese=y}} {{WikiProject Middle Ages|class=FA|importance=mid}} }}{{On this day|date1=2014-10-11|oldid1=629149262}} {{Talk:Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty/GA1}} == Requested move ==
:''The following discussion is an archived discussion of a [[WP:requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. Editors desiring to contest the closing decision should consider a [[Wikipedia:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the move request was: '''Rename'''. -- [[User:BrownHairedGirl|BrownHairedGirl]] [[User talk:BrownHairedGirl|(talk)]] • ([[Special:Contributions/BrownHairedGirl|contribs]]) 17:55, 5 February 2014 (UTC) ---- [[:Jin campaigns against the Song Dynasty]] → {{no redirect|Jin–Song Wars}} – Consistency with other articles such as [[Greco-Persian Wars]] and [[Ottoman-Venetian Wars]]. Also, the Song revanchism section shows that the Song at least started one campaign/war of their own against the Jin. [[User:Vctrbarbieri|Vctrbarbieri]] ([[User talk:Vctrbarbieri|talk]]) 18:00, 27 January 2014 (UTC) *'''Support'''. It reflects the content better. --[[User:Cold Season|Cold Season]] ([[User talk:Cold Season|talk]]) 00:46, 3 February 2014 (UTC) *'''Support'''. Oops, I'd forgotten about this one. Yes, the argument makes sense. When the article was first named, there was almost no info on the Song counteroffensives, but now there are full-fledged sections on Song initiatives. No need to latch on to the old title when the new one is better. [[User:Madalibi|Madalibi]] ([[User talk:Madalibi|talk]]) 04:28, 3 February 2014 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of a [[WP:RM|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page or in a [[WP:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section.
